Title.evidence: CHAMP: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Mesenchymal Stromal Cells in Critical Limb Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: In this phase I/II trial, 32 extremities with CLI requiring BKA were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive intramuscular injections of allogeneic MSCs (n=16) or autogenous concentrated bone marrow aspirate (cBMA, n=16)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety and therapeutic mechanisms of mesenchymal stromal cells (MSC) in CLI patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was proangiogenic cytokine expression, measured at the time of amputation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 32 extremities with CLI requiring BKA were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: Ten patients have been treated per protocol.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Preliminary results indicate potential efficacy in proangiogenic cytokine expression.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were monitored, with no severe events reported thus far.
